trans-unit.source: The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SortKey"></xref> class stores sort criteria for use by sort controls.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SortKey.#ctor"></xref> constructor creates and initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SortKey"></xref> class.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SortKey.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)"></xref> constructor creates and initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SortKey"></xref> class using the specified attribute name, matching rule, and sort order.
The name of the attribute to use as a sort key.
The object identifier (OID) of the matching rule for the sort.
`true` if the sort is ordered from the lowest to highest or `false` if the sort order is from highest to lowest.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SortKey.AttributeName"></xref> property specifies the name of the attribute to use as a sort key.
The name of the attribute to use as a sort key.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SortKey.MatchingRule"></xref> property specifies the object identifier (OID) of the matching rule for the sort.
The OID of the matching rule for the sort.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SortKey.ReverseOrder"></xref> property specifies if the sort should be returned in reverse order.
This property is `true` if the sort is ordered from the lowest to highest or `false` if the sort is ordered from highest to lowest.
